@graph.name: Chicken Tikka Masala - Belly Full
@graph.description: Chicken Tikka Masala is tender, juicy pieces of charred chicken, swimming in an unbelievable luscious, flavor-packed creamy tomato sauce!

@graph.name: Amy
@graph.description: Well, hey there! Amy here. Welcome to my little corner of the internet! If you’re looking for tried and true, fuss-free, budget-friendly, delicious, every day recipes, you’ve come to the right place.

@graph.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
@graph.description: The best homemade Chicken Tikka Masala recipe like you get at your favorite Indian restaurant! With tender, juicy pieces of charred chicken, swimming in an unbelievable luscious, flavor-packed creamy tomato sauce.

video.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
video.description: The best homemade Chicken Tikka Masala recipe like you get at your favorite Indian restaurant! With tender, juicy pieces of charred chicken, swimming in an unbelievable luscious, flavor-packed creamy tomato sauce, it will make your taste buds sing with every bite.

recipeIngredient: 1 cup plain yogurt or Greek yogurt
1/2 teaspoon red chili powder ((not cayenne pepper))
1 1/2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breast (, cut into small bite-sized pieces)
1/4 cup 1/4 cup water (, only if needed)

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, whisk together all the ingredients for the marinade; add the chicken and toss to coat. Let marinate for 15 minutes to 1 hour (ideally overnight in the fridge, if time permits.)
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl, whisk together all the ingredients for the marinade; add the chicken and toss to coat. Let marinate for 15 minutes to 1 hour (ideally overnight in the fridge, if time permits.)

recipeInstructions.text: Warm oil in a large skillet (preferably cast iron) over medium-high heat. Once shimmering, add chicken pieces in batches, if necessary, making sure not to crowd the pan. Let them fry, untouched, for 1 minute to develop a crust, then saute until browned for about 5 more minutes. Set aside and keep warm.
recipeInstructions.name: Warm oil in a large skillet (preferably cast iron) over medium-high heat. Once shimmering, add chicken pieces in batches, if necessary, making sure not to crowd the pan. Let them fry, untouched, for 1 minute to develop a crust, then saute until browned for about 5 more minutes. Set aside and keep warm.

recipeInstructions.text: Melt the butter in the same pan. Saute the onions until soft (about 3 minutes) while scraping up any browned bits stuck on the bottom of the pan. Add ginger and garlic; sauté for 30 seconds until fragrant.
recipeInstructions.name: Melt the butter in the same pan. Saute the onions until soft (about 3 minutes) while scraping up any browned bits stuck on the bottom of the pan. Add ginger and garlic; sauté for 30 seconds until fragrant.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the brown sugar, coriander, cumin, paprika, garam masala, and salt. Stir occasionally for about 15 seconds until fragrant.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the brown sugar, coriander, cumin, paprika, garam masala, and salt. Stir occasionally for about 15 seconds until fragrant.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour in the tomato sauce; let simmer gently for about 3-5 minutes, stirring occasionally until sauce thickens and becomes deeper in color.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour in the tomato sauce; let simmer gently for about 3-5 minutes, stirring occasionally until sauce thickens and becomes deeper in color.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in the cream until incorporated.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in the cream until incorporated.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the partially cooked chicken along with its juices back to the pan; cook for an additional 8-10 minutes until chicken is cooked through and the sauce is thick and bubbling. Pour in the water to thin out the sauce, only if necessary.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the partially cooked chicken along with its juices back to the pan; cook for an additional 8-10 minutes until chicken is cooked through and the sauce is thick and bubbling. Pour in the water to thin out the sauce, only if necessary.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve over cooked basmati rice, with Naan bread, and garnish with chopped cilantro.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve over cooked basmati rice, with Naan bread, and garnish with chopped cilantro.
